item.title: Protecting New Yorkers from extreme heat
item.description: Hot weather is dangerous. In New York City and across the country, more people die from extreme heat in an ordinary year than from all other natural disasters. Heat stress happens when your bodyâ€™s temperature increases quickly: The body can no longer control its temperature to cool itself down, which can quickly lead to death. At the NYC Health Department, we track heat stress deaths by reviewing causes of death recorded by the Bureau of Vital Statistics.
